question.body: The inner-most layer, the stratum basale, has keratinocyte stem cells with large intracellular structures including, endoplasmic reticulum structures and mitochondria. What is the primary purpose of this level?

multiple_choice.choice: cells rapidly divide to produce more cells to replace upper layers
cells produce nutrients to feed the upper layers

response.feedback: Correct. This layer produces more cells that differentiate and die as they as they move superficially from the dermis.
Incorrect. Keratinocytes produce keratin, but the keratinocyte stem cells are responsible for self-renewal of cells.
Incorrect. Nutrients diffuse into the epidermis from the blood supply in the dermis.

part.hint: Cells in the stratum basale are metabolically active and undergo rapid proliferation.
Consider the definition of stem cells: cells that self-renew and differentiate into other cell types.

question.body: The stratum lucidum is one of the superficial layers of the epidermis. This structure is nearly translucent. Why?

multiple_choice.choice: Organelles transition to transparent phenotype for enhanced cell function.
This layer is only extracellular matrix with no cells.
Cell-cell connections give a transparent appearance.

response.feedback: Correct. Cells no longer need organelles to perform functions, so they are lost.
Incorrect. There is no longer cell function.
Incorrect. There are still cells at the outermost layers, but they are all dead.
Incorrect. Loss of subcellular structures leads to the transparent appearance.

part.hint: The outermost layer of cells on the epidermis are dead.
Dead cells no longer undergo cellular processes including protein production and ATP synthesis.
